biography.value: Trained in the use of poison, assassins are remorseless killers who work for nobles, guildmasters, sovereigns, and anyone else who can afford them.

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

The assassin makes two shortsword attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage, and the target must make a [[/save con 15 format=long]], taking [[/damage 7d6 type=poison average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d8 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage, and the target must make a [[/save con 15 format=long]], taking [[/damage 7d6 type=poison average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
&Reference[fey]{Fey} Ancestry. The drow has advantage on saving throws against being &Reference[charmed]{charmed}, and magic can’t put the drow to sleep.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
Innate Spellcasting. The drow’s spellcasting ability is &Reference[cha]{Charisma} (spell save DC 11). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components:

At will: dancing lights

1/day each: darkness, faerie &Reference[fire]{fire}, levitate

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
Sunlight Sensitivity. While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
Assassinate. During its first turn, the assassin has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the assassin scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
Evasion. If the assassin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw to take only half damage, the assassin instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
Sneak Attack. Once per turn, the assassin deals an extra [[/damage 4d6 average=true]] damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the assassin that isn't &Reference[incapacitated]{incapacitated} and the assassin doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
You create up to four torch-sized lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover in the air for the duration. You can also combine the four lights into one glowing vaguely &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} form of Medium size. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a new spot within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light winks out if it exceeds the spell's range.

macro.name: Dancing Lights

description.value:
Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 15-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with &Reference[darkvision]{darkvision} can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

Each object in a 20-foot &Reference[cube]{cube} within range is outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Any creature in the area when the spell is cast is also outlined in light if it fails a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed dim light in a 10-foot radius.

Any attack roll against an affected creature or object has advantage if the attacker can see it, and the affected creature or object can't benefit from being &Reference[invisible]{invisible}.

One creature or loose object of your choice that you can see within range rises vertically, up to 20 feet, and remains suspended there for the duration. The spell can levitate a target that weighs up to 500 pounds. An unwilling creature that succeeds on a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw is unaffected.

The target can move only by pushing or pulling against a fixed object or surface within reach (such as a wall or a ceiling), which allows it to move as if it were climbing. You can change the target's altitude by up to 20 feet in either direction on your turn. If you are the target, you can move up or down as part of your move. Otherwise, you can use your action to move the target, which must remain within the spell's range.

When the spell ends, the target floats gently to the ground if it is still aloft.
